Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; discoloured white slip; interior surface completely worn; exterior, slip worn in places, reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on both sides of the sherd make it impossible to identify the vase's style. The exterior slip, the inscription and the thinness of the sherd indicate that it most likely belonged to a chalice or a kantharos. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1405) (phase 2)
